definitions:
to cause to shake

O terramoto estremeceu o prédio.

The earthquake shook the building.

to shake; to tremble

O prédio estremeceu devido ao terramoto.

The building shook due to the earthquake.

to shiver

Estremeciamos no frio.

We were shivering in the cold.
to terrify; to send shivers down someone's spine
first-person singular (eu) personal infinitive of estremecer
third-person singular (ele and ela, also used with você and others) personal infinitive of estremecer
first-person singular (eu) future subjunctive of estremecer
third-person singular (ele and ela, also used with você and others) future subjunctive of estremecer
description: estremecer (first-person singular present indicative estremeço, past participle estremecido)
etymology: From es- + Vulgar Latin *tremiscere, from Latin tremēscō (“I begin to tremble, shake”), from tremō (“I shake, tremble”) + -ēscō, from Proto-Indo-European *trem- (“tremble”).
